message.content:
cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IR. 

The paper proposes a framework for predicting terrorism activities using fuzzy inference systems, which involves combining fuzzy logic and approximate reasoning. This falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) as it involves decision-making models. The paper also deals with the classification of events related to terrorism, which falls under the category of computer security and cryptography (cs.CR). The use of adaptive neuro-fuzzy inference system (ANFIS) involves machine learning, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and also involves the use of neural networks, which falls under the category of signal processing (cs.SI). Finally, the paper deals with the analysis of news articles related to terrorism events, which falls under the category of information retrieval (cs.IR).
